intro: Apopetalum, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Melanthiaceae. It is characterized by its basal leaves that are typically lobed or divided, and its flowers are usually clustered in umbels. The plant produces small, greenish or white flowers that are not showy, which is why it is sometimes called apopetalum, meaning "without petals." It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant has been historically used in traditional medicine, though its toxicity requires caution.
